question: What is Java?
options: A programming language
A type of coffee
A type of operating system
A type of server

question: What is the latest version of Java?
options: Java 8
Java 10
Java 11
Java 12

question: What is the difference between JDK and JRE?
options: JDK is a subset of JRE
JRE is a subset of JDK
JDK contains the JRE along with development tools
JRE contains the JDK along with development tools
answer: JDK contains the JRE along with development tools

question: What is the use of the keyword 'final' in Java?
options: It is used to declare a variable as constant
It is used to declare a class as final
It is used to declare a method as final
All of the above

question: What is an interface in Java?
options: An interface is a class with only abstract methods
An interface is a class with only concrete methods
An interface is a class with both abstract and concrete methods
None of the above
answer: An interface is a class with only abstract methods

question: What is the difference between method overloading and method overriding?
options: Method overloading is done at compile time while method overriding is done at runtime
Method overriding is done at compile time while method overloading is done at runtime
Method overloading involves creating a new method with the same name but different parameters in the same class or subclass
Method overriding involves creating a new method with the same name and parameters in the same class or subclass
answer: Method overloading involves creating a new method with the same name but different parameters in the same class or subclass

question: What is the purpose of the 'static' keyword in Java?
options: To define a constant variable
To create a new instance of a class
To declare a method that belongs to the class rather than to an instance of the class
None of the above
answer: To declare a method that belongs to the class rather than to an instance of the class

question: What is a constructor in Java?
options: A method that is called automatically when an object of a class is created
A method that is used to destroy an object of a class
A method that is used to create a new instance of a class
None of the above
answer: A method that is called automatically when an object of a class
